intro: Desmotrichum unicorne, commonly known as the single-horned desmotrichum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive single horn-like structure on its fruit, which is a unique botanical feature. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. The flowers are small and clustered, often producing a yellow or brown coloration.
